\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 99136}

\subsection*{The Positives and Negatives}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{C15H21NO2}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 20 mg & oral & Ethylphenidate & powder / crystals\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 15 mg & insufflated & Ethylphenidate & powder / crystals\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 0.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
This report is short and its purpose is to just outline what I found to be the positives and negatives. The following summarizes the doses and effects that I experienced.



Typical Dose:  -Oral = $\sim$ 10 -- 30 mg 

               -Insufflated = $\sim$ 5 -- 30 mg

Note: My doses varied wildly and depended completely on my tolerance.



Duration: 

-Oral: Onset = $\sim$30 minutes

       Peak = $\sim$1 Hour

       Duration = $\sim$3 -- 4 Hours



-Insufflated: Onset = $\sim$ 0 -- 10 minutes

              Peak = $\sim$15 -- 25 minutes

              Duration = $\sim$1 -- 2 Hours



Positive Effects:



- Stimulation (Mental and Physical).

- Mild euphoria (Less pronounced from oral doses).

- Increased concentration.

- Increased desire to talk.

- Clear headed (No visual or audio distortions noted).



Negative Effects:



- It was easy to become over stimulated (Jitters, sweating and reduced circulation to extremities).



- Anxiety (It was very easy to become anxious).



- Agitation (Particularly on the comedown from insufflated doses).



- Increased sensitivity to light (Bright screens could be dazzling).



- Lethargy (It was hard to have energy to do unwanted/unplanned tasks).



- I also found it to be damaging to my mucus membranes (Ethylphenidate is alkaline with pH $\sim$9)



- Psychologically addictive (I found it very easy to redose).

\end{document}
